item.title: MIT Museum Inside Out
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
N52
Location Description: 
MIT Museum
Sponsor: 
Museum
Format: 
demonstration
exhibit
games
hands-on activity
open facility to visitors
tour
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Free admission all day at the MIT Museum, as it turns itself inside out for the Institute's Open House Day (and the first day of the Cambridge Science Festival!). Go behind the scenes of the Museum and explore unique artifacts from MIT's history, as well as innovations in art, science and technology in Cambridge and beyond. The day's programs will feature tours, hands-on activities, and a chance for visitors of all ages to see and chat with the people behind the Museum's MIT 150 exhibition.
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Confronting the Climate Change Challenge
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
56
Location Description: 
Building 56, Outside
Sponsor: 
MIT
Format: 
children's activity
demonstration
exhibit
games
hands-on activity
social media
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Come learn about the science and the policy of climate change! Hands-on activities and demonstrations will help you visualize the current state of climate knowledge and what Earth will look like when MIT is 300 years old. Students and researchers from a wide range of expertise will be on hand to answer questions and discuss global change issues.

read more
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Microsystems in Action
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
32
Location Description: 
Stata Center, Building 32, Dreyfoos Tower
Sponsor: 
Microsystems Technology Laboratories
Format: 
demonstration
hands-on activity
tour
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Learn how the chips in your cell phone, video game, etc., are made. Take a window tour of the "lab", to see the big machines that it takes to make these tiny devices (tours are limited to 10 people each; there will be four 20-min tours); see demonstrations of new applications (e.g., light emitters, medical measurements).
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Hands-On Tour of Physics Junior Lab
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
4
Location Description: 
Building 4 - Room 361, Physics Lab
Sponsor: 
Department of Physics
Format: 
demonstration
hands-on activity
open facility to visitors
Max Participants: 
20
Family Friendly: 
no

Tour of the Physics Department's teaching labs, where "Junior Lab" --- an infamously difficult course in experimental physics --- takes place. See a collection of experiments which tell the story of how "modern physics" was discovered in the early 20th century.
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Celebrating Discovery at MIT: An Undergraduate Research Poster Session
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 14:00 - 16:00
Location: 
W33
Location Description: 
Building W33, Rockwell Cage
Sponsor: 
Undergraduate Advising and Academic Programming
Format: 
poster session
Max Participants: 
100
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Since 1969, the Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program, commonly known as “UROP,” has been facilitating research collaborations between faculty and students, across all disciplines. Today, UROP is considered MIT’s “signature” program, and more than 85% of undergraduates participate.

read more
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Astronomy Open House @ MIT
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
NE80
Location Description: 
Building NE80, Hill Building
Sponsor: 
Kavli Institute for Astrophysics & Space Research
Format: 
exhibit
poster session
video
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Astronomy Open House @ MIT will open the doors of the Kavli Institute for Astrophysics and Space Research (MKI) to showcase current research in astronomy and astrophysics carried out by MKI researchers, and science education activities facilitated by MKI staff and high school students in the Youth Astronomy Apprenticeship (YAA).

read more
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Tours of Chandra X-ray Observatory Operations Control Center
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
NE80
Location Description: 
Building NE80, Hill Building
Sponsor: 
Kavli Institute for Astrophysics & Space Research
Format: 
tour
Family Friendly: 
no

NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory is a telescope specially designed to detect X-ray emission from very hot regions of the Universe such as exploded stars, clusters of galaxies, and matter around black holes. Join us for a tour of the Chandra Operations Control Center (OCC) located right here in Cambridge! The Chandra OCC controls the operation of the Chandra spacecraft while it is in orbit. Scientists and engineers design an observation plan for efficient scheduling of the observatory.

read more
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Nuclear Science and Engineering Open House
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
24
Location Description: 
Building 24 - Rooms 110, 112, 115 and 121
Sponsor: 
Department of Nuclear Science and Engineering
Format: 
demonstration
exhibit
hands-on activity
Max Participants: 
40
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Come visit us and see a cloud chamber that shows how radiation is all around us, a demonstration of a fusion reactor, an online time-of-flight experiment that uses the MIT reactor, and an exploration of the periodic table with examples of each element.
